That was translated many years ago

metroid, I disagree, I think skoteinós put it very aptly indeed, it can "give the feeling very well".

Why, the greatest philosophers in history have all been asking this question since the dawn of mankind "Can it get the feeling very well?".

If I am not mistaken, this quote can be attributed to the ancient greek philosopher of art Ptolemais of Cyrene. In which it is said, during a heated argument with Pythagoras himself over the perceived ratio of his theorem on pi she shouted "But do it give the feeling very well!? Huh!? I'll fuck you up west side style yo!". She lost this argument as Big P pulled out his 45., leading to most of her work and life being wiped from the annals of history, but I think she won morally at least.

Even art itself is protected by the definition it has, this definition being "Does it give the feeling very well?"

One cannot call 'retarded' or 'moronic' things which one does not understand, after all it do give the feeling very well.

*Sips tea in british*
